title: I have written a book. It is not yet published. How do I take control of the copyright of my unpublished book before I start sending it out? - Quora

response.answer_text: You can self publish ebook chapters or whole physical books. You can publish in serial forms from websites or review magazines. Or, you can follow the biblical advice to “Render unto Caesar that which belongs to Caesar.” In this case, Caesar is the publishing company that focuses their talents to the duties of marketing, editing, publishing, and distribution among others. We give up control over some things to gain greater expertise and capacities in areas we need. That decision is always yours. Good luck, Mac

The copyright is yours automatically. But if you want some kind of stamped proof that it is yours, you can do a simple thing. Print out your entire manuscript, put your name and the date of completion on it. Send it to your own address using the government postal service of your country. When it returns to you, keep the packet safely, unopened. It is now officially stamped and dated by a government agency. If at some later point of time, you find yourself in need of proof that the story you are claiming as yours is indeed yours, you may produce the packet. I was told of this in a creator’s workshop being held by a team of copyright lawyers in New Delhi a few years ago.
